Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: forestorchid
Reviews.Content: This place is not safe. The staff lock all the doors at night with padlocks, including the fire doors. The rooms have burgular bars. If there was a fire everyone would DIE.

Reviews.Title: “A strange little place with no-frills”
Reviews.Author: manasicaje
Reviews.Content: Overall: A strange little place with no-frills. Bizarre to find a faux-tudor building on Balmoral Rd surrounded by glam, modern highrises. Despite being the cheapest available hotel in the area, I thought $105AUD per night (booked on lastminute.com.au) was a bit expensive for what was delivered. But I guess you’re paying for the area, being comparatively close to Orchard. Room #226: Non-smoking single room has two single beds (extremely firm!), effective aircon, very small TV, telephone, two sitting chairs, small desk with basic coffee-making facilities, wardrobe, small bathroom with shower, bath, toilet and sink. The good points - The staff & service: Efficacious, no-nonsense but friendly. I requested an iron, but was told ironing could only be done by housekeeping … my shirt was collected and returned perfectly ironed within about 10min. - The location: For me, the location was fine. About 10min walk to Newton MRT and Newton Circus Hawker Centre. From there a 2min train to Orchard. - The rooms: Not my style (obviously inspired by the English B&B), but the theme is carried off with full commitment! The chairs are floral, the pedestal sink is Georgian, the art is tapestry, the wardrobe is antique … you get the idea. The not-so-good points: - Cleanliness: Found black hairs in the bathtub on arrival and then again on Day 3. On Day 2 the fresh towels had quite a large clump of long black hairs stuck to them. - Appearance of common areas: A bit shabby and rundown. - TV: is there for decoration. The best channels had poor reception … the worst channels looked like a snowstorm. - Internet: Non-existent in rooms. I was told I could connect my laptop to the LAN line in the reception (for $3SGD/hour) but tried unsuccessfully on two separate occasions. A public computer in the lobby has internet for $1SGD/15min but I didn’t try. No wireless available anywhere in the hotel, and trust me … it’s almost impossible to access a wireless network in Singapore without a local mobile phone account. - Bath and shower: Hand-held shower head connected via hose from bath-taps. But, there was nowhere at head-height to “house” the shower head so had to be held by hand. Inadequate shower screen meant bathroom (and some things in it) got wet during shower. Also, no plug so couldn’t run a bath.

Reviews.Title: “very terrible stay in this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: maximus_x9
Reviews.Content: I had never had a experience like this in other hotels. I was planning to stay for 2 days and even invited my friends over for few drinks at night..but the restaurant closes at 10pm. As we were hungry we ordered McDonald .As we waited in the room...by the way, the sign says no visitors are allowed after 10.45pm..penalty...29++.... ridiculous rule. As my friends were smokers, they opened the window to smoke..And in came a call from the receptionist that i was liable to pay $30 for opening the window when the air con is running, ridiculousness rule.Again a call came in,this time asking how many of us were in the room.I told the mad lady that 3 of us were in the room. the mad lady told me that no visitors are allowed after 10.45pm and tat i have to go down and register their names.since we were waiting for the McDonald delivery, we thought of going down once the delivery guy was here..And ridiculousness rule again..the door is locked after 11pm..Before we proceeded down, there was a knock on the door..The mad lady just barged into tje room and wanted my friends particulars.At this point i was fuming with anger as i have never been embarrassed .. I told the mad lady that i wish to check out immediately as i was not happy with this kind of service. She told me that she don't know how to access the computer to do checkout.The next day i checked out and stayed in amara hotel...It was a beautiful stay at this hotel and staff were friendly..And no rules.....As for the lady who was rude and discourties, she was one of the owner of Sloane court hotel..I will never stay or recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sallygoldcoast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came across Sloane Court some years ago when we used to stay at the hotel across the road which has now been demolished. We were drawn to the appearance of this hotel which resembles an old English Pub. We only ever ate in the restaurant until this recent trip when we decided to give the accommodation a go even amid all the negative remarks on Trip Advisor. We had just that morning disembarked from the Queen Elizabeth after spending 3 glorious weeks in the lap of luxury so we are reasonably particular folks. We were very impressed with the accommodation at Sloane Ct FOR THE PRICE and one has to remember what one pays in other Singapore Hotels. When visiting Singapore feel we only need a bed as we are out and about so much, loving the city as we do. We refuse to pay exorbadent sums for a hotel room hence us giving Sloane Ct a go as it is a third of anywhere else. Hotel room clean and comfortable, bathroom clean and adequately supplied FOR THE PRICE. Reception very friendly and helpful. We had no problems with the hotel, great quiet area, taxis a plenty at front door, 15 minute walk to MRT. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Nas28
Reviews.Content: Unless I ever lose my memory of my stay at this god forbidden place, I will never, in this life time of the ones after, step into Sloane Hotel ever again! We had a bad hunch the moment we reached the place. The first feeling I had was that I had just stepped into a very old haunted house. Service at the front desk and room service was very poor - no smiles or hello or "thank you see you again". In fact, we felt like the people working there didn't want us there at all. Though it was generally clean, everything in the hotel was OLD. They look old and yes, smelt OLD too. Even the CRT tvs were showing programs in black and white (we even had to tune some of the channels ourselves). We decided to go out for supper after midnight but found the hotel's main entrance locked and we couldn't get out (or rather stuck in the horrible hotel). There was also no one was at the reception desk. Most lights at the reception area were also switched off. A sign was placed near the door informing guests to press the bell "ONLY once". We did as the sign says. Approx 30 seconds later, one of the staff, a middle aged chinese lady, appeared in her PJs, bed hair and a very unhappy face (we assumed it was because we had disturbed her sleep) to open the door for us. The same happened when we came back to the hotel. Only this time, we had to ring the bell more than once and had to wait for almost 10 minutes for someone to open the door for us to enter the hotel!! On the day we were supposed to check out (check out time is at noon by the way), we received calls every 2 minutes from 1200 sharp to check if we had left our room. When told that we needed another 10 minutes, the receptionist said, "No, only five minutes for you to come to the reception to hand over the room key." We were appalled at her level of service. We were even more upset when the first thing she said to us in front of other guests at the reception during check out at 1230, "Terrible people!!". We were so surprised at her remark that we just didn't know what to say to her!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience (2 nights stay)”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Loo
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception lady is the most terrible reception i have met in my life. I have paid the full amount of the 2 night stay online through latestays. and we give them the booking number, she couldn't find. somemore told us that normally online booking normally do not need to pay, just insert the credit card number to secure the booking. HELLO...is it first time got customer from Latestays. then we mention we already paid. then she search back the computer, then she say oh is at the deleted folder. Wow, how can the reception move the customer paid booking to the delete folder. then, secondly she ask how many ppl will stay, i say 2 person, then she say oh u paid the amount is 1 person, so need to put in extra money for extra person. she insist us to do so. but when we make online booking, there mention got 2 single bed in the room. then she suggest us to add extra sgd 40 for 2 nights for the extra person, so that means a night sgd 20. then actually i will only stay 1 night, and my bf will stay for 2 night.then she say like that i have to charge you sgd29+7% per night. then i say why don't you just charge me sgd 20 on that night. she say cannot, that one must charge two night. then i say normally hotel also got 2 single bed or 1 double bed. and why she insist us to pay the extra, she keep telling that got customer actually four person but only book 2 person. then that is different case. now we only have 2 person. after that she say hotel is different from theirs, hotel won't check how many person. After i hear the last sentence she told me, i feel that i do not want to talk to this person anymore. and i pay the amount. cause she also work in Sloane Court HOTEL. she say singapore is count by person but not room. and the room is spacious but not clean. the aircond with sound. the bed without blanket. then we found in the cupboard, one of the blanket is unfold nicely. and the other one is dirty. so, i assume that there is no room service. the bathroom is not well kept. the chair look very old. and the sofa look dirty. only the wood floor look shiny. in conclusion, I would not go back again. I rather spend more on other hotel. my friend told me budget hotel like Fragrance is better than this Sloane Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Balmoral Road”
Reviews.Author: RishadP
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't stay here, but went to book the family room for friends of mine who were planning to visit with their two kids. I was met at reception by two sullen middle-aged ladies at the reception whose refusal to crack a smile was almost comical. I explained what I was after quite politely, and was curtly told that four adults were not allowed to share the room. I assured them that the kids really were kids, ie, 9 and 6 years old. I asked to see the room. It looked dismal, although I liked that they had bunkbeds for the kids. The furnishings looked old and worn out, and the bathroom could have used a scrubbing. I was then told that the extra bed would be charged extra. I said that four beds was all I needed, but they said the room only allowed for three beds, and a fourth would be charged extra, even though there was a double bed and two single bunkbeds already in the room. The lady seemed keen to throw in extra charges anywhere she possibly could, which was pretty amazing. Needless to say, I left as soon as I could.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky option for those who don't want bland”
Reviews.Author: haylesHerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sloane Court for 5 nights so had enough time to 'see' it in kll its glory. If you want a bland, typical international hotel, don't stay here. It will not be your bag at all. If however you are travelling and love family run hotels, run by locals who really do know their town - this is fabulous. If you don't know Singapore, you will look at the map of this hotel and think i' s too far away. we did when we first arrived. However, Singapore is very small and it takes not even 10 mins by a regular bus into the main shopping street. We did this, but as we have a 4 year old with us, we often got taxis back at night as he was tired. A taxi from Chinatown to sloane Court was very cheap. In London you would pay 20 pounds for this - it was about 3/4 pounds in Singapore. As for the service - I am stunned that people say it was poor. We've been on the road with our kids for 3 months and this was probably the most helpful place we have stayed. Some hotels sigh when you ask for help - this one bent over backwards. Re the rooms - the bed was very comfy, they did not hesitate to give us for free a good, clean mattress for our son, the towels were a bit thin - laundry service was fast - what else? It is not like an internatioanl hotel where everything matches - the curtains may not match the sofa upholstery, but the curtains are in good condition as is everything else. I think we loved it also as Singapore is so sanitized that to find something a little more 'human' in Singapore was a breath of fresh air. It is quirky - based on an old english inn that does not really exist in england any more - the restaurant serves therefore a very old english menu - very good food. The resto is not very atmospheric, but again, it is what you would have found in the UK at one point in time. Just because of this, I can see why people think it looks tired - it is not - it is old-fashioned, but well loved. Why is it that people always expect places to constantly modernise ? Is it not ok to just maintain well what works? Anyway,I feel it necessary to tell you that this is the 1st trip advisor comment I have ever made as i feel so strongly that this hotel is misunderstood. It is expensive - This is because Singapore is expensive - cheap is hard to find in this town. I am vigilant about cleanliness as the though of a 4 year old getting bed bugs is gross - i cannot fault the cleanliness of this place. We would go back if i ever wanted to be in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Moverly
Reviews.Content: Not a top of the market hotel but conveniently located and very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid, save up and get better.”
Reviews.Author: ybouc
Reviews.Content: Singapore is sorely lacking in affordable accomodations, and this hotel proves it. It is one of only a handful of "affordable" (80SGD and below) hotels in the city, and just like the others, it should probably be avoided. The rooms COULD have a certain old-style cachet, if they were not let go like the rest of the hotel is. Cleanliness is very spotty, and I ended up with at least one big cockroach in my room in just a one night stay. In terms of service or amenities, it's practically non-existant, although the rooms do have broadband internet. I stayed there as a last resort for one night, and won't go back. It's just too dingy for the price. But since affordable hotels in Singapore are really rare, just be wary of your finances if you are vacationing there, as staying at the Sloane Court will undoubtedly leave a bad impression on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “very badly treated”
Reviews.Author: jefus
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel via hotel.com, did not see the reviews earlier but when I wanted to cancel for want of a better hotel, the daggers and blades came out. very bad impression - never want to deal with them again. this looks like the ugly side of singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sad”
Reviews.Author: Snowy07
Reviews.Content: So Sad to see the Sloane Court sink to its present level. I and many of my friends have been using the hotel for over thirty years, yes thirty, maybe even longer!! It was and is a family owned business, but as regular guests we have seen the inner struggle for control within the said family for quite some time. The Sloane used to be a regular meeting point for many of Singapore’s well known expatriate characters, and the restaurant was always busy. During my last and final visit I was discussed with the now new family “Towkay” extremely arrogant and rude to a point were the loyal staff were very embarrassed. The rooms were a disgrace and the room rates ???? Goodbye Sloane, goodbye to all the staff I will miss you all.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever”
Reviews.Author: traveller2570
Reviews.Content: this is the last hotel you wanna stay. With the same price you can get much much better hotels in singapore. The owner tried to charge you in whatever way she can. The condition of the rooms are so bad. They have only the minimal basic stuff. The location is very bad as well. Not near the MRT station at all. The hotel is very run-down, not only the room but everything inside. The stuff was not friendly and they lied to you to make sure that you stay in their hotel. If you happen to stay there, make sure that whatever they said are in black and white, if not, whatever they promised today is not valid tomorrow. Very sucky hotel. Not sure how it calls itself a hotel. I think it is worse than a hostel. Pleaes avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest - Stay Away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravelalot
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night at this hotel and while i was ready to give it an 'okay, but with some problems' until i was ready to check out. On first arrival, the hotel has definite 'run down' feeling. A dark and dank front desk smelling very strongly of mildew, it just feels tired. On the way to the room, you pass through a hallway where you get visibility of all the hotels discards and junk, which is really a turn off. The room itself however was very clean and the bathroom was surprisingly nice and mold/mildew free. Bedcovers a bit grimey, TV very small, but overall the room was ok. My big problem occured though with the hotel staff. As a man alone checking-in, they warned me that if i had an extra person, i would have to pay extra. I thought it was an odd warning, but said of course (why wouldn't I). I was at the hotel alone and no one else joined me at all through the night. Upon check out however, they accused me of having an extra person and of bringing 'my girlfriend' into the hotel. They went so far as to claim the landlady saw me leaving with this mystery woman in the middle of the night (a complete lie, i went out at 23:30 by myself and even spoke with the landlady as the front door was locked)! Worse, the landlady looked me in the eye and continued to claim my girlfriend was with me and that the girl was still at the hotel. I asked her to get the girl and she said oh she must have just left. I was completely flabergasted by the outright dishonesty of the staff. I hoped that perhaps the landlady was mistaking me for someone else from the evening, but then when she told me the girl was still there (and then miraculously disappeared) i knew it was an outright lie. She also refused to go the room to see the single bed with the almost unruffled sheets. I don't know why the hotel would go so out of their way and be so dishonest as to accuse a guest of such misconduct, simply to extract 30 SGDs from the guest. I asked for an apology and was refused one. I refused to pay for the extra guest and providing this write up is about the only thing i can do. Stay away from this hotel. They are clearly very dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: kevpix
Reviews.Content: I was offered this hotel at the Airport Hotels Desk in arrivals at Changi Airport as a last resort. Singapore was very very busy. The brochure I was given, suggested a small quaint out of the way hotel. Set in the middle of a quiet residential area no where near the MRT...It was VERY out of the way.. nearest shop/ eating place at least a 7 minute hot humid walk. Quaint from the outside perhaps.. dire from the inside definitely. The sign outside hotel eb=ntrance read 'Restaurant closed Today' but I suggest from the faded and permanent fixture the restaurant had been closed for many yesterdays as well. The reception area comprised of a tiny cramped dark dank area with torn plastic covered seats, peeling paint and faded notices with aged brown sellotaped corners. Its only one storey so no lift of course ( so no good for the disabled) and then you find your ermmm... room. The pictures below say it all.. look out for no shower curtain but shower set against window curtain (not waterproof) look for bare wire cables over 'dressing table' then notice only one tap on basin, no light bulbs in bathroom fittings, mattress on raised wooden floor = bed and TV screen smaller than a small laptop. They were charging more for this standard room than I would normally pay in a 4 star hotel in Singapore.. I would rate this as a one star hotel, no more and compare the pics I have included with their brochure pics. In their defense they said the pics on their one page brochure were actually of a superior room ie.... only superior rooms come with bed, shower curtain, two taps, light fittings and light bulbs???? As I never saw a superior room I cannot comment. I was given a total refund for the nights I refused to stay ie all but my first night, and even the desk staff were sympathetic to my total misgivings and embarassed by their "hotels" sad existence I believe. I am not a vindictive person, as I said I was reimbursed for the nights I refused to stay but I would hate other travellers to be misled by their brochure as I was... if you are a very budget traveller you will have stayed in similar places or worse but you will not have paid any where near what they were charging. AVOID AVOID AVOID I subsequently moved to a small clean, friendly chinatown hotel at a MUCH cheaper rate with agreeable breakfast included, free water bottles in room and 24 hour free cable broadband internet connection, masses of shops and restaurants on doorstep and within walking distance of downtown Singapore. (Photos taken with laptop built in camera)

Reviews.Title: “Won’t Recommend Sloane Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desperate need of maintenance and a general clean-up. I had the feeling that everything gets done on a highly limited budget; from the untrained staff to the bed linen and towels. Although the rates and good, there are better places in Singapore in the same price range.
